text: Wendelin Werner (born 23 September 1968) is a German-born French mathematician. He works on random processes such as self-avoiding random walks, Brownian motion, Schramm–Loewner evolution, and probability theory and mathematical physics. In 2006, he won the Fields Medal "for his contributions to the development of stochastic Loewner evolution, the geometry of two- dimensional Brownian motion, and conformal field theory". He is professor at ETH Zürich. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 2008. == References == Category:Living people Category:Fields Medalists Category:1968 births Category:Pages with unreviewed translations Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Wendelin Werner
